definition: to waste/to defile/to abuse/to insult/to defile/to trample on/to wreck/also pr. [zao1 ta5]

sentences.english: But soup should not be wasted, for some salt had been put in it.
sentences.chinese: 然而湯是不應該糟蹋的，裏面放得有鹽呢。

sentences.english: She came across butchered hedges and flowerbeds choked with weeds.
sentences.chinese: 她發現樹籬被糟蹋，花壇裏野草叢生。

sentences.english: He had spoiled the soup by putting in too much salt.
sentences.chinese: 他往湯裏放鹽太多，把湯給糟蹋了。

sentences.english: Are the trees of the field people, that you should besiege them?
sentences.chinese: 田間的樹木豈是人，叫你糟蹋嗎？

sentences.english: If rich people buy food abuse, that and no difference also fish in troubled waters.
sentences.chinese: 如果有錢人買糧食糟蹋，那和趁火打劫也沒有差別。

sentences.english: He spoiled the soup by putting too much salt in it.
sentences.chinese: 他放了太多的鹽，把那盤湯糟蹋了。

sentences.english: My sister was horrified to find me trespassing on her side of the bedroom.
sentences.chinese: 妹妹看到我如此糟蹋她的牀，發飆了。

sentences.english: One bad apple spoiled the barrel.
sentences.chinese: 一個爛蘋果，糟蹋一整籮。

sentences.english: Itas just waste of time waiting ever once more .
sentences.chinese: 再等下去純潔是糟蹋時光。

sentences.english: Don't butcher that song by singing off key .
sentences.chinese: 別唱走調而糟蹋了那首歌。

sentences.english: The American People need to know who is costing them their hard earned money.
sentences.chinese: 美國人民需要知道是誰把他們的血汗錢給糟蹋了。
那首交響曲被糟蹋得不成樣了。

sentences.english: Pain wastes the body; pleasure the understanding.
sentences.chinese: 疼痛糟蹋身體，玩樂糟蹋思想。

sentences.english: Pain wastes the body; pleasure the understanding.
sentences.chinese: 疼痛糟蹋身體，玩樂糟蹋思想。

sentences.english: They are, in effect, destroying capital.
sentences.chinese: 它們事實上在糟蹋資本。

sentences.english: Slowly the wasters and despoilers are impoverishing our land.
sentences.chinese: 浪費者和掠奪者們在慢慢地糟蹋着我們的土地。

definition: to waste/to spoil/to destroy/to insult grievously
to ill-use/to humiliate/to degrade/to ruin/also pr. [zuo2 jian4]
to waste natural resources recklessly/not to know how to use things sparingly
to ravage/to devastate/to trample on/to violate
